name: "777" [HNR36J]-  JROCC BUNDLE
description:
Throughout 2013, in celebration of their 7-year Anniversary, HIT+RUN released seven highly limited-edition 7" vinyl singles, each side filled with exclusive songs by mystery CREW producers, pressed on colored vinyl and housed in a screen printed jacket. Only a strict 300 quantity of each were made (500qty of #6) and each has individually sold out.

All 29 tracks have been compiled onto this very special 2xLP full-length "777" album [HNR36], with each of the records pressed on one-of-a-kind two-color vinyl (red/blue & bone/gold). 

The LP cover art features a collage of all 14 screen printed "777" singles featuring self-portraits of each Producer. With additional photography by B+, Jason Barbegelott, Jesse Elias, Nassirah Nelson, and Marcoso Oliva. Design by Brandy Flower. Mastered by Jeremy Balliger. Track sequence by Kutmah. Distributed by Fat Beats, only 800 pressed.

This limited-edition bundle pack comes with one double vinyl album, a black T-shirt with a one-of-a-kind "777" multi-color metallic foil stamp, plus one limited-edition 2"  J.ROCC soft enamel pin. Only a strict 25 of these bundle packs will available so purchase now and product will ship on December 23rd.

name: CONTACT FIELD ORCHESTRA "Vol. 1" [HNR32] : BUNDLE
description:
"Sounds like Tom Waits and Augustus Pablo smoking opium on the bayou."  - Kutmah

The debut full-length album by CONTACT FIELD ORCHESTRA "Vol. 1" [HNR32] containing 17-tracks.  CFO cover monogram created by Los Angeles artist CRYPTIK. Each 12" vinyl is housed in a hand-printed chipboard sleeve silkscreened by HIT+RUN in downtown Los Angeles. 

Each vinyl purchase also includes a FREE DIGITAL DOWNLOAD code, and all PRE-ORDERS placed before November 8th, 2013 will receive:

- One (1) CFO "Vol. 1" on 12" vinyl (in screenprinted jacket)
- One (1) CFO x H+R chrome cassette (HNR16)
- One (1) CFO 1" metallic button
- One (1) CFO white vinyl sticker
- One (1) CFO "Vol. 1" digital download code

--------------

	"In 2008 I came across a box of 7” tapes at an estate sale in Altadena. The woman there said that they had belonged to her father and were “field recordings” of a turn-of-the century orchestra. It took me maybe another year to actually load them up and transfer them to the computer. When I did, what I found was an incredible documentation of indigenous folkloric music that was meticulously recorded and then later transfered to 2-track tape sometime in the 1960’s. The tapes were labeled “Contact Field Orchestra”-- a collection of field recordings that seem to date from sometime around the turn of the 20th century (possibly a little earlier). 

	After transferring the tapes and cleaning them up as best I could, I discovered that due to the frequency range, they must have been recorded largely with hand-made piezo transducers of some sort. Some of the tapes were partially destroyed, so I found that I had to re-play or play over the songs as best I could to fill-in and augment the original ideas. I tried to stay as true to the original recordings as much as possible. I’ll admit I took some liberties with the EQ (perhaps too much...) and where applicable added a small amount of delay and reverb to accent the track. (Okay, and maybe a few electric guitars...sue me.) 

	The result, I think, is an amazing collection of esoteric folk recordings of a mysterious band of San Gabriel miners turned musicians. Apparently having given-up after the gold boom, these folks stayed in what would later become Upper Mallard Canyon in Altadena -- living in the old Dawn’s Mine shaft, and crafting their own instruments from discarded mining equipment and whatever small guitars and banjos they had brought with them.

        The sound this orchestra created is like something out of a Jim Jarmusch film, and reminds me of an old Library of Congress or Folkways recording. The music itself is full of opposites -- hypnotizing and odd; meditative and jarring. It’s strangely familiar, but also distantly unrecognizable. Some songs are more minimalist in their approach, building up a rhythm with mbiras and percussion, while others seem to have much more harmony and tonal structure and almost Blues/Country feel. Either way, they had me hooked from the first bar, and I find myself returning to it again and again, irregardless of my heavy-handed noodling...
	
I’m really happy to have discovered this, and I hope you are too. 
	
	All the best, 
 	Damon Aaron

----------------------------------------------

Written and Produced by Damon Aaron 
Published by Fleischman Audio (BMI)
All songs Performed by Contact Field Orchestra
Additional Horns, Percussion & Melodica: Michael McDaniel
Mastered by Erick Labson
Monogram by Cryptik
Art Direction by  Brandy Flower
Jackets Screenprinted by Hit+Run Crew, Los Angeles

www.contactfieldorchestra.com
www.thehitandrun.com

© 2013 HIT+RUN, P.O. Box 861917, Los Angeles, California 90086 USA

=============================
=============================
RELEASE DATE: NOVEMBER 11th, 2013
=============================
=============================

name: SEVEN DAVIS JR.  "THE LOST TAPES VOL. 1"  [IZWID002]
description:
The second release on Kutmah’s IZWID imprint is a rare collection of bugged out electronic soul from the Los Angeles-based vocalist, producer and poet, Seven Davis Jr. “The Lost Tapes Vol. 1” spans 12 years of experimental, cosmic out-of-body-and-mind music, of mostly four and eight track recordings once lost in storage via a lengthly hiatus due to drug addiction and depression. 

Resurfacing in 2012, Seven Davis Jr.’s ‘Thanks’ appeared on Kutmah’s much lauded “Worldwide Family Vol. 2” compilation on Brownswood Recordings, after which the kaleidoscopic artist released the clattering funked beats of “Lo-Fi Vintage” and house-inspired “One” EP. 

For IZWID, “The Lost Tapes Vol. 1” is a creative blueprint for Davis Jr.’s brilliantly unorthodox approach with his beautifully raw drums and psychotropic harmonies. “I made a lot of this music many years ago and other labels and artists hated on me for it,” says Davis Jr. of the lost tapes. “They said it was too weird, too different, sounded like drug music (it was) and they told me I was going to hell, for ‘Pornostar’. Years later; new life, new city, new day and age. I found the music again, which I never stopped loving and decided to send it all to Kutmah.” 

This 8-song EP by SEVEN DAVIS JR, comes on heavy 12" vinyl & housed in a hand-screenprinted chipboard jacket. Limited edition of 300.

Side 1 
------
I Don't Give A Fuck (4:55)

name: CHITLINS "EP" (HNR25)
description:
With the release of his self-titled EP in the Summer of 2013, CHITLINS makes his official solo recording debut on HIT+RUN.  

CHITLINS aka Biff Chitlins aka Jeremy aka Jeremiah Balliger is a musician, composer & producer who was born and raised in Los Angeles, CA.  The ten tracks on his debut EP are striking and diverse excursions of the moment.  Late night stories and rolling sonic shifts combine to emblazon this diverse collection of songs.  Seductive beats, exotic instruments and production wizardry mesh together to send the listener on a 25-minute adventure.

CHITLINS navigates new perspectives on instrumental production, alongside intense vocal compositions including the deviant anthem "Wanna", and the hip hop-infused "Dulce De Leche".  The album kicks off with incendiary party starters "Firestation" & the aspirational "Simplex".  Nestled amongst the dank clouds of Marley's ghost and a storm of Hendrix's acid-drenched guitars, rests the gloomy and defiant oeuvre "Constructs".  The political skank of "Liars" and decaying jazz of "Dreamers" showdown with the dreggy drums of "Dirt Nap", and in the end the listener is transported to a place only known as "The Nagual". 

CHITLINS debut EP features an appearance by Norwood "Fish" Fisher, founding member of the legendary Los Angeles ska-punk band FISHBONE. The digipak cd showcases brilliant artwork by Los Angeles graffiti icon MEAR ONE of the notorious CBS Crew. The limited-edition full-color digipak cd features the CHITLINS logo (designed by Brandy Flower of HIT+RUN) embossed across the cover. Each copy of the album comes with one 4" clear vinyl sticker, as well as a collectible 1" metallic button pack (comes with 3 buttons).

In 2012, "Dulce" (the instrumental version of "Dulce De Leche") first appeared on the compilation HIT+RUN Presents "Road Kill Vol. 1" which featured 29 exclusive tracks by luminary Los Angeles producers THE GASLAMP KILLER, DAEDELUS, J.ROCC, RAS_G, KUTMAH, MONO/POLY, THAVIUS BECK and many more.  CHITLINS has lent his Mastering skills and studio production wizardry to over 20 albums for LA art Crew HIT+RUN since 2010, and this EP celebrates their 25th release. 

CHITLINS' work as a Recording Engineer for Interscope Records from 2000-2004 led to his current position as a Senior Writer/Composer for Beacon Street Studios located in Venice Beach CA.  CHITLINS is the mastermind behind many popular television commercial jingles and award winning spots for clients such as ADIDAS, MAZDA, BMW,  GEICO, MILLER, BURGER KING, and BACARDI to name a few.  CHITLINS' satirical vocal performance for WENDY'S is much-rumored to have inspired Jay-Z to write his infamous "Death of Auto-Tune".  CHITLINS currently lives in Venice, California.

Look for limited-editon green & silver "Wanna" flexi-discs, limited-edition 1" button packs, upcoming Los Angeles-area EP release parties, as well as CHITLINS live appearance at "CRASH+BURN 2013" the annual HIT+RUN Summer party on July 27th at the Echoplex. 

www.chitlins.com

name: CONTACT FIELD ORCHESTRA "Mixtape"  [HNR16]
description:
In 2008 I came across a box of 7" tapes at an estate sale in Altadena.The woman there said that they had belonged to her father and were "field recordings" of a turn-of-the century orchestra. It took me maybe another year to actually load them up and transfer them to the computer. When I did, what I found was an incredible documentation of indigenous folkloric music that was meticulously recorded and then later transfered to 2-track tape sometime in the 1960's. The tapes were labeled "Contact Field Orchestra"--a collection of field recordings that seem to date from sometime around the turn of the 20th century (possibly a little earlier).  

After transferring the tapes and cleaning them up as best I could, I discovered that due to the frequency range, they must have been recorded largely with hand-made piezo transducers of some sort. Some of the tapes were partially destroyed, so I found that I had to re-play or play over the songs as best I could to fill-in and augment the original ideas.I tried to stay as true to the original recordings as much as possible. I'll admit I took some liberties with the eq (perhaps too much...) and where applicable added a small amount of delay and reverb to accent the track. (Okay, and maybe a few electric guitars...sue me.)  

The result, I think, is an amazing collection of esoteric folk recordings of a mysterious band of San Gabriel miners turned musicians. Apparently having given-up after the gold boom, these folks stayed in what would later become Upper Mallard Canyon in Altadena -- living in the old Dawn's mine shaft, and crafting their own instruments from discarded mining equipment and whatever small guitars and banjos they had brought with them. 

 The sound this orchestra created is like something out of a Jim Jarmusch film, and reminds me of an old Library of Congress or Folkways recording. The music itself is full of opposites -- hypnotizing and odd; meditative and jarring. It's strangely familiar, but also distantly unrecognizable. Some songs are more minimalist in their approach, building up a rhythm with mbiras and percussion, while others seem to have much more harmony and tonal structure and almost Blues/Country feel. Either way, they had me hooked from the first bar, and I find myself returning to it again and again, irregardless my heavy-handed noodling... 

 I'm really happy to have discovered this, and I hope you are too.  

All the best,  
Damon Aaron 


Cassette only / Limited to 250 copies

SAMPLE: http://soundcloud.com/hit-run/contact-field-orchestra-vol-1

http://www.contactfieldorchestra.com



======================================
======================================
Full length album "Volume 1" coming late Summer 2013 (Vinyl & digital)
======================================
======================================

name: JONWAYNE "How Stella Got Her Groove Back"  [HNR12]
description:
Hit+Run proudly presents the 12th release in their mercurial mix cd series with "How Stella Got Her Groove Back" by LA producer/rapper JONWAYNE.  Hosted by Kyle, this fifty-minute tribute to Stella is explicit proof to everyone who said it couldn't be done. The momentous mix is comprised of unreleased beats and songs/oddities by Flying Lotus, Samiyam, Low Limit, Dibiase, Ta'rach, Mndsgn, Devonwho, Tuxedo Kamen, Culprit and Zeroh, classics by Busta Rhymes and Squarepusher, plus a dozen exclusive JONWAYNE tracks.  Its an awesome time, hopefully she remembers the little people when she gets huge!

Last March to critical praise, JONWAYNE released his debut instrumental album "Bowser" on Alpha Pup, "a virtual dream world emerged onto a monstrous landscape of demented beats and deft harmonies."  He has performed at Low End Theory in Highland Park, as well as special events around Los Angeles for Hit+Run, Friends of Friends, Hipsters Heart Hip Hop and the We Did It Collective.  With his lyrical alter-ego, JONWAYNE has recently collaborated with producers Flying Lotus, Kutmah, Dibiase (Dark Horsemen) and is currently finishing up his full-length debut rap album to be released on Stones Throw Records in 2013.

Good work Stella, we never thought it would happen...

Running Time: 50:58

SAMPLER: http://soundcloud.com/hit-run/jonwayne-how-stella-got-her

name: MERCURY - Sweatshirt
description:
Crew has but one infallible, unchangeable motto, FREEDOM. Freedom to discover any truth, freedom to develop, to live naturally and fully. One of China's emperors, Qín Shǐ Huáng Dì was killed by drinking a Mercury & powdered jade mixture (causing liver failure, poisoning, and brain death) intended to give him eternal life. The kingdom is within.

This 80% cotton black hooded sweatshirt comes with a large white water-based discharge on the back, plus a matching 3-inch round embroidered patch emblazoned on the front left chest pocket. This lightweight hoodie has a zipper, drawstrings and two front pockets. Hand-printed in downtown Los Angeles by HIT+RUN CREW.

name: RAMMELLZEE
description:
HIT+RUN pays tribute to visual artist, graffiti writer, performance artist, rap musician, and sculptor from New York...one of the legendary pioneers of hip-hop, RAMMELLZEE (1960-2010).  

Infamously known for his song "Beat Bop" with K-Rob (released on Jean-Michel Basquiat's label TARTOWN in 1983) and featured in the film "Style Wars."  Rammellzee's graffiti and art work is based on his theory of Gothic Futurism, which describes the battle between letters and their symbolic warfare against any standardizations enforced by the rules of the alphabet.

Rammellzee performed in self-designed masks and costumes of different characters which represented the "mathematical equation" that is Rammellzee.  On the basis of his Gothic Futurism approach, he described his artistic work as the logical extension into a new phase which he calls IKONOKLAST PANZERISM. 

Classic Men's 100% Cotton American Apparel black t-shirt, with white plastisol print on the front. Hand-printed in downtown Los Angeles by HIT+RUN CREW.

RIP RAM

name: SHATTER - Black
description:
I cannot tell if what the world considers 'happiness' is happiness or not. When one considers the way they go about attaining it, they are carried away grim and obsessed, in the general onrush of the human herd, unable to stop themselves or to change their direction. All the while they claim to be just on the point of attaining happiness. Happiness in comfort is not real happiness. When you can be happy in the midst of hardship, then you see the true potential of the mind. The end is near!

name: AXIS - Black
description:
The most merciful thing in the world is the inability of the human mind to correlate all its contents. We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far. The sciences, each straining in its own direction, have harmed us little, but some day the piecing together of dissociated knowledge will open up such terrifying vistas of reality that we shall either go mad from the revelation or flee from the light into the peace and safety of a new dark age. I am falling into the sky!

Large White plastisol print on the front chest of American Apparel Black 100% cotton men's tee.

name: DUST - Black
description:
It is an unfortunate fact that the bulk of humanity is too limited in its mental vision to weigh with patience and intelligence those isolated phenomena, seen and felt only by a psychologically sensitive few, which lie outside its common experience. Men of broader intellect know that there is no sharp distinction betwixt the real and the unreal; that all things appear as they do only by virtue of the delicate individual physical and mental media through which we are made conscious of them. The prosaic materialism of the majority condemns as madness the flashes of super-sight which penetrate the common veil of obvious empiricism.
